title: Beeswax wrap
subTitle: The eco-friendly alternative to cling wrap and single use-plastic

marketingArguments.title: What is beeswax wrap?
marketingArguments.speech: Beeswax is an eco-friendly product made with organic cotton and organic beeswax. These properties allow it to be washable and reusable! It also contains natural anti-bacterial properties ideal for preserving your food!

marketingArguments.title: Sustainable product
marketingArguments.speech: Each package is designed to last up to one year.  you can wash it in cold water and air dry it. Your Beeswax wrap will retain its properties after washing. It is also 100% biodegradable.

marketingArguments.title: Multiple use
marketingArguments.speech: With its 3 different sizes, you can keep all kinds of food: fruits, vegetables, flowers, cheese, bread, fresh snacks… It can be used to cover anything that a plastic wrap could cover.

marketingArguments.title: How to use your beeswax wrap?
marketingArguments.speech: Start by unfolding the beeswax. Crease it 3 times to soften it and make it very malleable. Your beeswax wrap is ready. Pack your seasonal fruits, your favourite vegetables, your homemade sandwiches or cover your bowls or containers in a snap.

marketingArguments.title: Daily use
marketingArguments.speech: To cover a bowl or other container, simply use the warmth of your hands and apply light pressure of 2/3 seconds to shape the bee wrap. You can rub lightly with your fingers to make it the same shape as your target. To protect your food without container, place it in the middle of the wrap and close it.

marketingArguments.title: How to clean your beeswax wrap
marketingArguments.speech: Between two uses of your beeswax wrap, remember to clean it well. You’ll see, it’s very simple. Always wash it in cold water. Hot water may remove the beeswax from the wrap and melt it.

marketingArguments.title: When it will no longer sticks
marketingArguments.speech: Hang on, it's reusable more than 100 times, so that shouldn't arrive so soon! Each wrap should last at least one year of normal use. But it may stick less after a while. You can either recycle it of renew it. To do that you can just buy some beeswax, shred it on and put it in your oven at 60°C for 2 minutes. Here you go again!

marketingArguments.title: Best 3 tips
marketingArguments.speech: 1. Always wait until your dishes are cold before covering them with a bee wrap. 2. Do not put your bee wrap in direct contact with raw meat or fish. 3. You can put it in the fridge or freezer. Be careful, it cannot stand the heat of the oven or microwave.
